Introduction/Yamato.Japanese: 大和型戦艦、一番艦、大和。推して参ります！
Introduction/Yamato.English: First of the Yamato-class battleships, Yamato. Heading forth!

Introduction/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 大和型戦艦一番艦大和、対空火器を大幅に強化致しました。
Introduction/Yamato Kai.English: First of the Yamato-class battleships, Yamato. Now with much upgraded anti-air weaponry.
Introduction/Yamato Kai.Note: After being damaged by American submarine, Yamato returned to Kure for extensive repairs. Two secondary guns were removed and replaced with anti-aircraft flak guns and Radar.

Library/Yamato.Japanese: 大和型戦艦一番艦、大和です。艦隊決戦の切り札として、呉海軍工廠で極秘建造されました。当時の最高技術の粋を結集されたこの体、二番艦の武蔵とともに、連合艦隊の中枢戦力として頑張ります！
Library/Yamato.English: First of the Yamato-class battleships, Yamato. As the trump card for the Decisive Battle, I was made in utmost secrecy at the Kure Naval Yard. With the most up-to-date and sophisticated technology concentrated in my body, along with the 2nd ship, Musashi, I will do my best as the centre of the combined fleet!
Library/Yamato.Note: Decisive Naval Battle, or Kantai Kessen, was the IJN's strategic doctrine during WWII, in which after a series of operations had weakened the US fleet, battleships would finish the last, and presumably, the strongest part of the fleet.

Secretary 1/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 提督～？ あの～、いえ、いいですけど…
Secretary 1/Yamato Kai.English: Admiral~? Erm~ no, its okay, but...

Secretary 2/Yamato.Japanese: ホテルですって？ち、違います！
Secretary 2/Yamato.English: You called me a hotel? N-no, I'm not!
Secretary 2/Yamato.Note: Due to her highly luxurious living facility and the fact that she spent most of her service life in the harbor, she was nicknamed "Yamato Hotel".

Secretary 2/Yamato Kai.Japanese: んもぉ～、ホテルなんて言わせませんよ！

Secretary 3/Yamato.Japanese: あのー？ そんなに気になります？ やっぱり副砲がちょっと多いの？
Secretary 3/Yamato.English: Erm... are you that interested? Well, is it because I have a lot of secondary guns?
Secretary 3/Yamato.Note: 2 triple 155 mm turrets were removed later to make space for more anti-aircraft armaments.

Secretary 3/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 提督？ あの、まあ…居住性は他の娘とは段違いではあるのだけれど…いいの？
Secretary 3/Yamato Kai.English: Admiral? Um... well, my living conditions are noticeably different than the other girls'. ...Is that okay?
Secretary 3/Yamato Kai.Note: Air conditioned quarters, bathhouse, kitchen with refrigeration facility. full course meal for officers with live band playing in the background. Most of these considered highly luxurious for combat vessels of its time.

Idle/Yamato.Japanese: ん…あ…提督ごめんなさい。主砲ちょっと邪魔ですか？
Idle/Yamato.English: Mm... ah... I'm sorry, admiral. Are my main guns in your way?
Idle/Yamato.Note: Yamato's main cannons are the largest naval guns in the world.

Secretary Married/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、少しお疲れではないですか？
Secretary Married/Yamato.English: Admiral, are you not a bit tired?

Secretary Married/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 提督、少しお疲れではないですか？大和が特製紅茶、お入れしましょうか。気持ちが休まりますよ。ちょっと、待っていて下さいね。
Secretary Married/Yamato Kai.English: Admiral, are you feeling a bit tired? Shall I make some special tea for you? It will help you feel relaxed. Ufu♪ Please wait a little while.

Wedding/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、いつもありがとうございます。連合艦隊の旗艦を務めるよりも、敵戦艦と撃ちあうよりも、今、こうしている時が私は一番好き。大和は…ずっと提督の、あなたの側で、頑張ります。
Wedding/Yamato.English: Admiral, as always, thank you so much. Even more than serving as flagship of the Combined Fleet... and more than fighting enemy battleships... it's now... this moment... that I love the most. I will... always, Admiral... at my darling's side, I shall do my best.

Looking At Scores/Yamato.Japanese: 大本営からの通信ですか？
Looking At Scores/Yamato.English: A communiqué from the Imperial Headquarters?

Looking At Scores/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 我が艦隊の戦績ですか？楽しみです。
Looking At Scores/Yamato Kai.English: Our fleet's military records? Looking forward to it.

Joining A Fleet/Yamato.Japanese: 戦艦大和、連合艦隊、出撃です！

Equipment 1/Yamato.Japanese: 改装ですね？ありがたいです！
Equipment 1/Yamato.English: A remodel, then? Thank you so much!

Equipment 2/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 対空、対艦。どちら重視かなぁ？
Equipment 2/Yamato Kai.English: Anti-air, Anti-ship. Which one should I be focused on...?
Equipment 2/Yamato Kai.Note: Over the years Yamato replaced few of its secondary guns in exchange for better anti-air capability, to counter the increasing threat of aerial attacks.

Equipment 2/Yamato.Japanese: あ、ありがとうございます！

Equipment 3/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 大和、嬉しい。提督、感謝です♪
Equipment 3/Yamato Kai.English: Yamato is pleased. Thank you, admiral!

Equipment 3/Yamato.Note: ⇧ shared with expedition selection, resource collection, instant repair and development

Supply/Yamato.English: I am grateful for your assistance.
Supply/Yamato.Note: She often speaks in very polite/honorific form.

Docking Minor/Yamato.Japanese: ちょっと、お風呂に行ってきます。
Docking Minor/Yamato.English: I'm going to the bath for a bit.

Docking Minor/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 短めのお風呂、いただきます。
Docking Minor/Yamato Kai.English: I shall take a short bath.

Docking Major/Yamato.Japanese: イッタッタ～ ごめんなさい、私がここまでやられるなんて～
Docking Major/Yamato.English: Ow-w-w. I'm sorry, I didn't expect they'd get me that badly~
Docking Major/Yamato.Note: Literally "have been had to that extent", implying the damage she received were beyond her expectations.

Docking Major/Yamato Kai.Japanese: あ、甘く見た訳じゃないんだけど、ごめんなさい。
Docking Major/Yamato Kai.English: I...I didn't underestimate (the enemy), though I'm sorry.

Docking Complete/Yamato.Japanese: 損傷艦の修復が完了致しました。
Docking Complete/Yamato.English: Repairs on the damaged ship are completed.

Docking Complete/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 修理完了の艦娘が在るみたいです。
Docking Complete/Yamato Kai.English: Repairing of the ship daughter seems to be completed.

Construction/Yamato.Japanese: 新造艦の建造が完了したようです。
Construction/Yamato.English: The construction of the new ship seems to be complete.

Construction/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 新しい艦娘（かんむす）が戦列に加わりました。
Construction/Yamato Kai.English: New ship girls has been added to our lineup.

Returning From Sortie/Yamato.Japanese: お疲れ様です。艦隊、帰投しました。
Returning From Sortie/Yamato.English: Thank you for your hard work. The fleet has returned.

Returning From Sortie/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 艦隊が無事帰投しました。良かったぁ～！
Returning From Sortie/Yamato Kai.English: Our fleet has returned safely. That's great~!

Starting A Sortie/Yamato.Japanese: 戦艦大和、推して参ります。

Battle Start/Yamato.Japanese: さぁ、やるわ！砲雷撃戦、用意！
Battle Start/Yamato.English: Yeah, let's go! Naval battle, ready!

Battle Start/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 大和、砲雷撃戦、はじめます！

Attack/Yamato.Japanese: 第一・第二主砲、斉射、始め！
Attack/Yamato.English: First and second cannons, volley fire, start!

Attack/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 敵艦捕捉、全主砲薙ぎ払え！
Attack/Yamato Kai.Note: ⇧ shared with day/night special attacks, support expedition team arrival

Night Battle/Yamato.Japanese: 戦艦大和、夜戦を敢行します！

Night Attack/Yamato.Japanese: 夾叉(きょうさ)か･･･うん、次は直撃させます。
Night Attack/Yamato.English: Bracket fire, huh... Yes, the next shot will be a direct hit.
Night Attack/Yamato.Note: 夾叉 (Kyousa), or bracket, means a succession of two salvos, one over and one short, or one right and one left, with no straddles. When this happens, minor adjustments are needed.(while straddle means both short and over, or both right and left shots occur in the SAME salvo)

Night Attack/Yamato Kai.Japanese: そうか･･･それなら･･･やるしかないわね！
Night Attack/Yamato Kai.English: Is that so... well then, I have to do this!

MVP/Yamato.Japanese: 大和が一番ですか。少し晴れがましいですね。次の海戦もお任せ下さいね。
MVP/Yamato.English: I'm number one? I'm a bit proud of myself. Leave the next sortie to me!

Minor Damage 1/Yamato.Japanese: そ、それで直撃のつもりなの！？
Minor Damage 1/Yamato.English: D-did you think you landed a direct hit?

Minor Damage 2/Yamato.Japanese: 傾斜復元しないと…。注水を急いで！
Minor Damage 2/Yamato.English: I'm starting to list... ballast pumps, hurry!

Major Damage/Yamato.Japanese: くっ、こんな所で、大和は、沈みません！
Major Damage/Yamato.English: Hmph, Yamato, will not, sink at such place!
Major Damage/Yamato.Note: She was listing two or three times during Operation Ten-Go

Sunk/Yamato.Japanese: また…逝くのね…総員…最上甲板…武蔵…信濃…あとは頼みます…
Sunk/Yamato.English: Again... I pass away... all hands... top deck... Musashi... Shinano... I leave the rest to you...
Sunk/Yamato.Note: Yamato was ultimately destroyed by a magazine explosion, unleashing a mushroom cloud more than 3.7 miles high that could be seen almost a hundred miles away on Kyushu. Note that historically both Musashi and Shinano were sunk earlier than Yamato.

00:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: マルマルマルマル。深夜ですね。

01:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: マルヒトマルマル。提督、そろそろお休みにならないと。
01:00/Yamato Kai.English: 0100. Admiral, shouldn't you be going to bed soon?

02:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 提督？まだ寝なくて大丈夫ですか？現在時刻マルフタマルマルです。
02:00/Yamato Kai.English: Admiral? Not going to bed, are you okay? It is now 0200.

03:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: マルサンマルマル。そろそろ流石にお疲れじゃないですか？
03:00/Yamato Kai.English: 0300. At this time, certainly shouldn't you be tired?

04:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 現在時刻マルヨンマルマルです。提督、そろそろ朝になっちゃいます。
04:00/Yamato Kai.English: It is now 0400. Admiral, it will soon be morning.

05:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 提督、マルゴーマルマルです。空が白み始めてきちゃいましたね。
05:00/Yamato Kai.English: Admiral, 0500. The sky is becoming white now.

06:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 朝です。マルロクマルマル。提督、朝は本当に御早いですね。
06:00/Yamato Kai.English: It's Morning. 0600. Admiral, the morning really came quickly, didn't it?

07:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: マルナナマルマル、朝食の時間。大和ホテル自慢のコンソメ御飲みになります？
07:00/Yamato Kai.English: 0700, Breakfast time. How about some of Hotel Yamato's famous consomme?
07:00/Yamato Kai.Note: The Yamato was used as a meeting place for high-level officers, so she had a very good mess; so good that Yamamoto gained weight from living on the Yamato.

08:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 現在時刻マルハチマルマルです。連合艦隊旗艦としてそろそろ動きますね。
08:00/Yamato Kai.English: It is now 0800. The combined fleet will be moving soon.

09:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: マルキュウマルマルです。提督、今日の作戦行動はどうされますか？
09:00/Yamato Kai.English: 0900. Admiral, how is today's battle mobilization going?

10:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 提督、他の艦隊の運用はどうされます？時刻は今、ヒトマルマルマルです。
10:00/Yamato Kai.English: Admiral, how are the other fleets? It is currently 1000.

11:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: ヒトヒトマルマル。そろそろ昼食の準備をしないと…。何がいいですか？
11:00/Yamato Kai.English: 1100. I have to start preparing for lunch soon... What would be good?

12:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: ヒトフタマルマル ランチタイムに大和ホテル自慢の…あぁ…ホテルじゃないです
12:00/Yamato Kai.English: 1200. Hotel Yamato's famous lunch time's... wait, I'm not a hotel.

13:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: ヒトサンマルマル、です。食後は少し眠くなりますね。
13:00/Yamato Kai.English: It's 1300. You get a bit tired after eating, yes?

14:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: ヒトヨンマルマルです。ふぁ～…はっ！あ、寝てませんよ！？

15:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: ヒトゴーマルマル。提督、ラムネでも飲まれますか？
15:00/Yamato Kai.English: 1500. Admiral, will you have a Ramune?

16:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: ヒトロクマルマル。そろそろ夕暮れ時ですね。

17:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: ヒトナナマルマル、提督、そろそろ日が暮れて来ました。
17:00/Yamato Kai.English: 1700, Admiral, it's almost time for the sunset.

18:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 現在時刻ヒトハチマルマルです。今日は半舷上陸にしちゃいます？
18:00/Yamato Kai.English: It is now 1800. Shall we let half the ship go ashore today?
18:00/Yamato Kai.Note: The ship's crew was divided into port and starboard, with alternating shore leave while docked.

19:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: ヒトキュウマルマル。艦隊執務はここまでにして、お夕食にしましょう。
19:00/Yamato Kai.English: 1900. The fleet work has ended, let's have dinner.
19:00/Yamato Kai.Note: Non-combat ops in the IJN ended, as a rule, at 1800.

20:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: フタマルマルマルです。ディナーはフルコースですよー、なんたって大和ホテルの…
20:00/Yamato Kai.English: 2000. Dinner is a full course~, after all, Hotel Yamato's...

21:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: フタヒトマルマル。提督、大和の居住性、いかがでしょうか？
21:00/Yamato Kai.English: 2100. Admiral, why not partake of Yamato's livability?
21:00/Yamato Kai.Note: Even ratings on the Yamato got a personal locker on board; a rarity in the IJN.

22:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 現在時刻、フタフタマルマルです。そろそろお風呂タイムかな？
22:00/Yamato Kai.English: It is now 2200. Time for a bath, yes?

23:00/Yamato Kai.Japanese: 時刻はフタサンマルマルです。提督、本日も一日、本当にお疲れ様でした。
23:00/Yamato Kai.English: It is 2300. Admiral, today, as always, thank you for your hard work.

Hinamatsuri 2016/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、ひな祭りですか？あら、かわいい、いいですね。武蔵？何を照れてるの？いいじゃない、ね？
Hinamatsuri 2016/Yamato.English: Admiral, is it Hinamatsuri? Oh my, how cute, it's good, isn't? Musashi? Why are you embarrassed? It's good, right?

White Day 2016/Yamato.Japanese: 提督！いいんですか、大和もいただいて？すみません。ありがとうございます。いただきますね。来年は頑張りますから！
White Day 2016/Yamato.English: Admiral! Is is alright, for Yamato to take these? I'm sorry. Thank you very much. I humbly accept. I'll do my best next year!
White Day 2016/Yamato.Note: Probably talking about their Hina dolls, while Musashi is embarrassed.

Spring 2016/Yamato.Japanese: もうすぐ春…か。うふふっ。桜を見ると不思議な気持ちになるわ、不思議。え？これは、涙？なんで…？
Spring 2016/Yamato.English: Spring is just around the corner, huh... Ufufu. Watching the cherry blossoms really gives me a mysterious feeling. Eh? These are... tears? Why...?

Third Anniversary 2016/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、艦隊は三周年を迎えました。おめでとうございます。大和も、大和も嬉しいです！ラムネで、乾杯しましょう！
Third Anniversary 2016/Yamato.English: Admiral, our fleet has reached its third year. Congratulations. I, Yamato... I am so happy for this occassion! Let's make a toast with some Ramune.
Third Anniversary 2016/Yamato.Note: It seems she remembers Operation Ten-Go. She went to Okinawa in Apr 6, 1945. On the other side, it could be a hay fever.

Rainy Season 2016/Yamato.Japanese: Iowaさん？ あ、かわいいですね、そのてるてる坊主。ねぇ、よかったら一緒に作りましょう。大和のはね、ここをこうして…。
Rainy Season 2016/Yamato.English: Iowa-san? Ah, isn't that teru-teru bouzu cute? Say, would you like to make one together? For the ones I make, it goes like...

Mid-Summer 2016/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、そんなに見ないでください！赤と白で少し派手だったかしら…そっ、そうですか？なら、よかったです。提督、ご一緒に。
Mid-Summer 2016/Yamato.English: Admiral, don't stare that much! Red and white is a little flashy isn't it... I-is that so? Then, that's good. Admiral, together then.

Final Battle 2018/Yamato.Japanese: 主砲、諸元修正急いで下さい。戦艦大和、全主砲、全力射撃、行きます。ってー！
Final Battle 2018/Yamato.English: Main guns, please hurry up with a firing solution. Battleship Yamato, opening fire with all guns. Fire!

3rd Anniversary/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、艦隊は三周年を迎えました。おめでとうございます！大和も、大和も嬉しいです！ラムネで、乾杯しましょう♪
3rd Anniversary/Yamato.English: The fleet’s 3rd Anniversary is here, Admiral. Congratulations! I’m, I’m happy! Let’s have a toast with ramune♪

Autumn 2016/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、秋ですね。秋は食べ物が美味しい季節。私も、新しいフルコース考えちゃいますね！
Autumn 2016/Yamato.English: It’s autumn, Admiral. Autumn is the season of delicious food. I’ve got a new full course thought up too!

Saury Festival 2016/Yamato.Japanese: 秋刀魚？秋刀魚漁支援ですか？了解しました。この戦艦大和、北方海域に向かいましょう！
Saury Festival 2016/Yamato.English: Saury? Support for saury fishing? Roger that. Battleship Yamato, heading to the Northern Waters!

Christmas 2016/Yamato.Japanese: メリークリスマス！提督、大和烹炊所フルパワーでクリスマススペシャルディナーをご用意しました。七面鳥も焼き上がりましたよ。あ、あれ？瑞鶴さん？
Christmas 2016/Yamato.English: Merry Christmas! I’ve used the full power of my galley to make a special Christmas dinner, Admiral. I’ve even roasted a turkey. H-huh? Zuikaku?

End of Year 2016/Yamato.Japanese: 鳳翔さん、これわどこしまえば…あぁ、そこですね？了解です。はぁ、大掃除は大変。提督は大和に任せて、ゆっくりしてくださいね？
End of Year 2016/Yamato.English: Where should I put this, Houshou-san… Ah, over there? Roger. Whew, spring cleaning is hard work. Please leave this to me and get a good rest alright, Admiral?

New Year 2017/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、新年あけましておめでとうございます。本年も大和と第一戦隊をどうぞよろしくおねがいします。さあ、いきましょう。
New Year 2017/Yamato.English: Happy New Year, Admiral. Please look after the 1st Fleet and I this year too. Now, let’s go.

Valentine’s Day 2017/Yamato.Japanese: よーし、大和の烹炊所フル活用しちゃった。チョコレットの前菜に、チョコスープ、メーンヂイシュはステーキのチョコレットソース掛け。
Valentine’s Day 2017/Yamato.English: Alright, I made full use of my galley. Chocolate appetizers, chocolate soup and steak with chocolate sauce as a main dish.

4th Anniversary/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、艦隊はついに四周年を迎えました！感謝ですね。大和も本当に嬉しいです。ラムネで…いえ、フルコースでお祝いしましょう！
4th Anniversary/Yamato.English: The fleet has finally reached it’s 4th Anniversary, Admiral! Thank you. I’m really happy too. Let’s celebrate with Ramune… No, with a full course!

Rainy Season 2017/Yamato.Japanese: 瑞雲…祭りですか、日向さん? はい、大和にも確かにそういった計画もあったのですが… えぇ、それとは、違う?
Rainy Season 2017/Yamato.English: A Zuiun… Festival, Hyuuga-san? Yes, I recall I had plans for something like that too… Eh, that’s different?

Early Summer 2017/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、少し厚くなってきましたね。今年も夏がくるですね。えぇ、水着ですか？あぁ、はい。一応武蔵と一緒に買ってあって。
Early Summer 2017/Yamato.English: It’s gotten a bit hotter, Admiral. Summer is here again this year. Eh, a swimsuit? Ah, yes. I went and bought one with Musashi just in case.

Late Autumn 2017/Yamato.Japanese: 武蔵？どうしたの？寒いの？機関部の調子でを悪いの？そう、ならいいけれど。何かあったら、お姉さんを相談してね？
Late Autumn 2017/Yamato.English: Musashi? What’s wrong? Are you cold? Is there something wrong with your engine room? I see, that’s good then. Let me know if you need anything alright?

Valentine’s Day 2018/Yamato.Japanese: もちろんデザートは、大和特製ハート型チョコケーキ。よし、完璧！さあ、提督をお呼びしましょう。提督！提督ー！あれ、提督？
Valentine’s Day 2018/Yamato.English: Of course it’ll be my special heart-shaped chocolate cake for desert. Alright, it’s done! Now to call the Admiral. Admiral! Admiraaal! Huh, Admiral?

5th Anniversary/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、艦隊はついに五周年を迎えました。おめでとうございます。大和も本当に感謝です。ラムネで…いえ、ワインとフルコースお祝いしましょう。
5th Anniversary/Yamato.English: The fleet is celebrating it’s 5th Anniversary, Admiral. Congratulations. I am truly grateful. Let’s celebrate with raumube… No, with wine and a full course meal.

6th Anniversary/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、艦隊はついに六周年を迎えました。本当におめでとうございます。感謝ですね。大和も嬉しいです。お祝いのフルコース 、腕によりをかけて、ご用意しますね。
6th Anniversary/Yamato.English: Admiral, the fleet has reached it's 6th Anniversary. My sincerest congratulations. I'm grateful. I'm happy too. I'll put my all into making a celebratory full course.

7th Anniversary/Yamato.Japanese: 提督、艦隊は、ついに七周年を迎えました。おめでとうございます！七年、考え深いですね？大和ラムネで…いえ、とっておきなワインで乾杯しましょう！
7th Anniversary/Yamato.English: Admiral, the fleet's 7th Anniversary is finally her. Congratulations! Shall we look back on these past 7 years? Let's have a toast with some Yamato Ramune... No, with a special reserve!
